title: Frequency and period - pendulum L for 2x period

content.question: A simple pendulum made with a string of length <math alttext="L sub P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>L</mi><mi>P</mi></msub></math> has a period of <math alttext="1.0 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></math>. What length of string should be used to make a simple pendulum with a period of <math alttext="2.0 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="the square root of 2, end root, L sub P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msqrt><mn>2</mn></msqrt><msub><mi>L</mi><mi>P</mi></msub></math>

<math alttext="the fraction 1 over the square root of 2, end fraction, L sub P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><msqrt><mn>2</mn></msqrt></mfrac><msub><mi>L</mi><mi>P</mi></msub></math>
<math alttext="one fourth L sub P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>4</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>L</mi><mi>P</mi></msub></math>

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
